comments.text:
Features that could be cool:

- Filter features within map view
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/filter-features-within-map-view/

- Add a georeferenced image
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/georeference-imagery/

- Add a canvas source
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/canvas-source/

- Animate the camera along a path
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/free-camera-path/

- Filter symbols by toggling a list
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/filter-markers/

- Fly to a location based on scroll position
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/scroll-fly-to/

Must have:
- Polygons
- View area

- Show and hide layers
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/example/toggle-layers/

- Add Marker Anchor
https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/api/markers/#marker

https://docs.mapbox.com/help/getting-started/directions/

This is rewritten to not use the controls from Mapbox and using controls made in Noodl instead.

TODO:

- Listen to new draw events and add items from it
Call focus on the parent Repeater
Format the Area to a nice text
Send an Edit event which is recieved by the Polygon Item component

Transition time in States is 1000 ms

The delay is 1500 ms to give it 500 ms wait time between states.

dynamicports.name: inputMappingScript

parameters.functionScript:
Outputs.houses = [
  {
    name: "Blue House",
    x: 0,
    y: 0,
    rotation: 0,
    width: 3,
    length: 2,
    height: 1,
    color: 0x0000ff, // Blue
  },
  {
    name: "Red House",
    x: 5,
    y: 0,
    rotation: 0,
    width: 1,
    length: 1,
    height: 1,
    color: 0xff0000, // red
  },
  {
    name: "Green House",
    x: 0,
    y: 2,
    rotation: 0,
    width: 5,
    length: 2,
    height: 1,
    color: 0x00ff00, // green
  },
  {
    name: "Cyan House",
    x: 2,
    y: 2,
    rotation: 45,
    width: 2,
    length: 5,
    height: 3,
    color: 0xff00ff,
  },
]

const objectId = Inputs.id
const object = Noodl.Objects[objectId]
if (object && object.x) {
    Outputs.position = `${object.x.toFixed(2)}, ${object.y.toFixed(2)}`
    Outputs.rotation = object.rotation.toFixed(2)
    Outputs.width = object.width
    Outputs.length = object.length
    Outputs.height = object.height
}
